ACT
18
Great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers
Of the part that belongs to the testator's paternal great-grandparents, one half is inherited in equal parts by the parents of his paternal grandfather, and the other half by the parents of his paternal grandmother.
Both great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers on the mother's side inherit the part that belongs to them in the manner specified in paragraph 1 of this article.
If there is no one of these ancestors, the part that would have belonged to him if he were alive is inherited by the ancestor who was his spouse.
If there is not one pair of those ancestors, the parts that would have belonged to them if they were alive are inherited by another pair of the same lineage.
If there are no great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers of one lineage, the part of the estate that would have belonged to them if they were alive is inherited by the great-grandfathers and great-grandmothers of the other lineage.
